events.event_description: U.S. crude oil production reached a record high, primarily driven by increased production in Texas.
events.citation: Crude oil production in the United States reached a record high in August 2023, led primarily by more production in Texas.

events.event_description: Texas crude oil production with API gravity between 30.1-40.0 degrees reached 2.58 million barrels per day, surpassing production of lighter crude oil for the first time.
events.citation: In June 2023, production of crude oil with an API gravity between 30.1–40.0 degrees reached 2.58 million barrels per day (b/d), surpassing the production of crude oil with a gravity between 40.1–50 degrees for the first time.

events.event_description: Lower 48 states achieved a new record of 4.75 million b/d for crude oil production with API gravity between 30.1 and 40.0 degrees.
events.citation: In September 2023, Lower 48 crude oil production in this API gravity range established a new record of 4.75 million b/d.

events.event_description: Lower 48 crude oil production with API gravity 40.1-50.0 degrees increased by 6.3% to 5.9 million b/d compared to the same period in previous year.
events.citation: Lower 48 crude oil production with an API gravity from 40.1 to 50.0 degrees grew 6.3% in the first 10 months of 2023 compared with the same period in 2022, rising to 5.9 million b/d.
